p.text: [Heading am Act 231 of 1985 s 5 and Sch 31]

In any case where by any Act relating to any of the public revenue or any public office or public department, or by any official regulation in any department, any oath or affidavit might, but for this Act, be required to be taken or made by any person—
on the doing of any act, matter, or thing, or
for the purpose of verifying any book, account, entry, or return, or
for any other purpose whatsoever,
the Governor may, by notification in the Gazette, substitute a declaration to the same effect as such oath or affidavit.

leg:level-vrnt.toc-caption: [395,105] s 16 To be notified in Gazette

p.text: From and after the expiration of twenty-one days next following the date of the Gazette wherein such notification is first published the provisions of this Part shall extend and apply to every case, office, or department specified in such notification.

leg:level-vrnt.toc-caption: [395,110] s 17 Oaths not to be taken thereafter

leg:heading.title: Oaths not to be taken thereafter

p.text: After the expiration of the said twenty-one days it shall not be lawful for any officer or other person to administer or cause to be administered any oath or to take or cause to be taken any affidavit in lieu of which such declaration has been substituted.

Every person who but for this Act might be required to take such oath or make such affidavit shall, in the presence of the officer or person empowered by the Act or regulation imposing the same to administer such oath or take such affidavit, make and subscribe such declaration; and such officer or person is hereby empowered and required to administer such declaration accordingly.

leg:level-vrnt.toc-caption: [395,120] s 19 This Part not to extend to certain oaths

leg:heading.title: This Part not to extend to certain oaths

p.text: Nothing in this Part shall extend or apply to—
the oath of allegiance in any case in which the same is required to be taken by any person appointed to any office; or
any oath or affidavit taken or made or required to be taken or made in any judicial proceeding in any court of justice.

leg:level-vrnt.toc-caption: [395,125] s 20 Abolition of extra judicial oaths

p.text: It shall not be lawful for any justice of the peace or other person to administer or cause or allow to be received any oath or affidavit touching any matter or thing whereof such justice or other person has not jurisdiction or cognisance by some Act or Imperial Act in force at the time being, and any person who does so without lawful authority is liable to imprisonment for 2 years.
[subs (1) am Act 51 of 1990 s 4 and Sch 2]
Provided that nothing in this section contained shall be construed to extend to—
any oath or affidavit before any Judge or Magistrate in any matter or thing touching the preservation of the peace, or the prosecution, trial, or punishment of offences; or
any inquiry held before any Magistrate in the nature of coroners' inquests respecting sudden deaths; or
any proceeding before either House of Parliament or a committee thereof; or

any oath or affidavit required by the laws of any foreign or other country out of New South Wales to give validity to instruments in writing designed to be used in foreign or other countries respectively; or
any declaration under this Part.
[subs (2) am Act 121 of 2001 s 4 and Sch 2 , effective 7 July 2003]

leg:level-vrnt.toc-caption: [395,130] s 21 Declarations in cases not specifically provided for

leg:heading.title: Declarations in cases not specifically provided for

p.text: The Registrar-General, a Deputy Registrar-General or any justice of the peace, notary public, commissioner of the court for taking affidavits, Australian legal practitioner authorised by section 27(1) to take and receive any affidavit, or other person by law authorised to administer an oath, may take and receive the declaration of any person voluntarily making the same before him or her, in the form or to the effect of the form in either the Eighth or the Ninth Schedule .

[subs (1) am Act 147 of 1997 s 3 and Sch 3 ; Act 71 of 2003 s 3 and Sch 7 , effective 1 January 2004; Act 120 of 2006 s 3 and Sch 3[3.19] , effective 4 December 2006 ; Act 17 of 2010 Sch 1.2, effective 18 May 2010]

Any statutory declaration taken and received prior to the commencement of the Oaths (Amendment) Act 1916 , before any commissioner of the court for taking affidavits, shall be deemed to have been duly taken and received.
[subs (2) insrt Act 12 of 1936 s 2]

ci:cite.ci:content: 9 Vic No 9 s 9; 46 Vic No 17 s 295

p.text: [s 21 subst Act 5 of 1916 s 4 ; am Act 20 of 1970 s 3]

leg:level-vrnt.toc-caption: [395,135] s 21A Penalty for taking and receiving statutory declaration without authority

leg:heading.title: Penalty for taking and receiving statutory declaration without authority

p.text: Any person who, not being by law authorised to take and receive a statutory declaration—
falsely pretends to be so authorised; or
takes and receives a statutory declaration
shall be guilty of an offence against this section.
Any person who takes and receives a statutory declaration in any capacity in which the person is not by law authorised to act shall be guilty of an offence against this section.
[subs (2) am Act 147 of 1997 s 3 and Sch 3]

Any person who is guilty of an offence against this section shall on summary conviction before the Local Court be liable to imprisonment for a term not exceeding twelve months or to a penalty not exceeding 2 penalty units.
[subs (3) am Act 121 of 2001 s 4 and Sch 2 , effective 7 July 2003 ; Act 94 of 2007 s 4 and Sch 2, effective 6 July 2009]
[s 21A insrt Act 12 of 1936 s 2 ; am Act 33 of 1965 s 4 ; Act 47 of 1993 s 3 and Sch 1 ; Act 31 of 1999 s 3 and Sch 4]

leg:level-vrnt.toc-caption: [395,140] s 22 Wills, deeds, etc, may be verified by declaration

leg:heading.title: Wills, deeds, etc, may be verified by declaration

p.text: Any attesting witness to the execution of any will or codicil, deed, or instrument in writing, and any other competent person, may verify and prove the signing, sealing, publication, or delivery of any such will, codicil, deed, or instrument in writing by such declaration in writing made as aforesaid before such justice, notary, or officer.

Whenever any declaration is made and subscribed by any person under or in pursuance of any of the provisions of this Part, every such fee as would have been due and payable on the taking or making of any oath or affidavit, shall be in like manner due and payable upon making and subscribing such declaration.
In all cases where by this Part, or under the authority thereof, or by virtue of any power or authority hereby given, a declaration—
is substituted in lieu of an oath or affidavit; or
is directed or authorised to be made and subscribed, although not substituted in lieu of an oath or affidavit,
such declaration, unless otherwise directed by the powers hereby given, shall be in the form, or to the effect of the form, in either the Eighth or the Ninth Schedule .

ci:cite.ci:content: 9 Vic No 9 s 11; 46 Vic No 17 s 295

leg:level-vrnt.toc-caption: [395,153] s 24A Declarations by persons unable to read

leg:heading.title: Declarations by persons unable to read

p.text: If it appears to the person before whom a statutory declaration is taken and received (the authorised person) that the person making the declaration (the deponent) is blind or illiterate, the authorised person must certify, in or below the jurat:
that the declaration was read to the deponent in the presence of the authorised person, and
that it appeared to the authorised person that the deponent understood the declaration, and
that the deponent subscribed the declaration (by signature or mark) in the presence of the authorised person.
[s 24A insrt Act No 28 of 2005 s 5.36 and Sch 5, effective 15 August 2005]
In all cases where by this Part, or under the authority thereof, or by virtue of any power or authority hereby given, a declaration—
is substituted in lieu of an oath or affidavit; or
is directed or authorised to be made and subscribed, although not substituted in lieu of an oath or affidavit,

any person who wilfully and corruptly makes and subscribes any such declaration, knowing the same to be untrue in any material particular shall be guilty of an indictable offence and liable to imprisonment for 5 years.
[s 25 am Act 94 of 1999 Pt 3 and Sch 4]

leg:level-vrnt.toc-caption: [395,160] s 25A False declaration for material benefit

p.text: In all cases where by this Part, or under the authority thereof, or by virtue of any power or authority hereby given, a declaration:
is substituted in lieu of an oath or affidavit, or
is directed or authorised to be made and subscribed, although not substituted in lieu of an oath or affidavit,

any person who wilfully and corruptly makes and subscribes any such declaration, knowing the same to be untrue in any material particular, and who derives or attempts to derive a material benefit as a consequence of the untrue particular is guilty of an offence and is liable on conviction on indictment to imprisonment for a term not exceeding 7 years.
[s 25A insrt Act 83 of 1996 s 3 and Sch 1]
